description_html:
Ever iconic, the number three, or “3,” has been widely interpreted
throughout time to symbolize life’s most mythical and harmonious allure—
representing the strength of unity in ancient, Borromean rings, or the three
sages Confucius, Laozi and Mozi in East, it has also come to represent the
spiritual representation of mind, body and soul, or in Pythagorean science,
triangular perfection manifest.

Auspicious and refined, the three-rings porcelain collection, made in
collaboration with Mexican heritage porcelain makers Anfora, draws from
its historical inspirations from past, present and future, or the beginning,
middle and end, to transcend both time and place, with elegantly crafted
vessels glazed to finish in earthy tones, perfectly imperfect yet ideal.

Tzelan’s Three Rings Porcelain Collection is made in collaboration
with Mexican heritage porcelain makers Anfora (since 1920), and
distributed by leading distributor of award-winning tabletop solutions,
Steelite International.
